name: Computer Science

schools.name: SABDEN Multi Academy Trust
schools.address: Head Office, Eastbourne Road, Seaford, BN25 4BA

addresses.address: Head Office, Eastbourne Road, Seaford, BN25 4BA

options: PGCE with QTS, full time with salary

enrichment.AboutCourse:
This course is run at Seaford Head School and trains candidates in KS3 & 4.\r
Candidates will be on a 50% timetable with 4 days in school and 1 day at Sussex University.\r
Candidates will be regularly watched by their mentor to ensure that they are succeeding on the course.\r
There will be a second, contrasting placement at a school which is mutually agreed.
enrichment.SalaryDetails:
You are paid at the lowest scale of a non-qualified teacher c. Â£14000\r
There are no fees for this course
enrichment.Qualifications: Candidates must have 5 or more GCSEs  in Grades A* to C (or equivalent), including Mathematics and English, and preferably a higher level honours degree.
enrichment.InterviewProcess: Candidates will be required to teach a small group of students for approximately 20 minutes, to judge their aptitude to teach. This will be followed by a formal interview.
enrichment.OtherRequirements:
Successful completion of Skills tests\r
Satisfactorily pass DBS and Health checks
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
\r
* Ambition and passion to become an outstanding practitioner\r
* A forward thinking and creative approach to teaching and learning\r
* Reflective and flexible in approach to teaching and learning\r
* Belief that every child can achieve excellence      \r
\r
\r
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork:
The age range of students is 11 to 16 years\r
There will be an opportunity to gain experience of KS5\r
The candidate will have a total of two placements\r
The second placement is approx 6 weeks

inst.TrainWithUs: Eastbourne Area School Direct Alliance recruits ITT students for most of the schools in Eastbourne and the surrounding areas. We offer Primary places for Key Stage 1 and 2. We also offer Secondary places for most subjects in a variety of high achieving schools. As part of your training you will get experience of KS3, 4 and 5. In addition we represent Special Needs schools who require Primary and Secondary teachers. All the schools in the consortium are experienced at training teachers and we have been very successful in aiding our School Direct candidates to obtain jobs when they have completed their training.
inst.TrainWithDisability: All of our sites meet the requirements for disabled access and we would work with any candidate to ensure they can succeed in their training without any impediment.
